intro: Chrysanthemum morii, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and is prized for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Chrysanthemum morii is also cultivated for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
